content.text: After weare.esaps.net went live, the next project came quickly.
story.esaps.net.
1547 said in the group: "I'll handle the design this time."
Shen Muchuan said nothing.
She really did only watch.
1547 posted drafts more frequently than she did, and in more versions. Every few days, something new appeared. Every version added more: color, layering, detail. Fuller and fuller.
A few times, Shen Muchuan wanted to say something. She typed a few words, then deleted them.
She was only watching.
One day, 1547 posted a version, then withdrew it herself more than an hour later.
No one in the group asked why.
Shen Muchuan stared at the "message withdrawn" notice for a while.
That night, she opened her canvas. The image held nothing except one tiny shape centered in a vast blank space.
She sent it to 1547 in private, with no text.
1547 replied a long time later.
Thank you.
Two weeks later, 1547 posted a new design draft in the group.
Take a look.
Three words.
2275 said it looked great. 1738 replied, "On point." 1548 said nothing and left a like.
Shen Muchuan did not reply.
On the day story.esaps.net went live, Shen Muchuan opened the site.
She read page after page. Finished one chapter, opened the next.
Then she stopped on one page.
In the middle of that page was a stretch of blank space. There was more distance between two paragraphs than elsewhere. No content there, just empty.
She stayed there for a while.
She closed the page and opened her canvas.
She drew an image: two people, both with clear outlines. Blank space between them, each standing steady in their own place.
She opened the private folder, paused for a second, then closed it.
She sent the image directly to 1547.
No text.
